subject: Re: [junit] JUnit in Net Beans
msgSnippet: You need the junit.jar in your classpath.  Not sure how you do that in NetBeans, but there is probably a project properties dialog window or something where
messageBody:
You need the junit.jar in your classpath. Not sure
how you do that in NetBeans, but there is probably a
project properties dialog window or something where
you can tell it which directories and jar files should
be in your project path.

Good luck.

Jim

--- nayoo1979 <nayoo1979@...> wrote:

> Hi
>
> I am a complete newbie in JUnit and today is my
> first day learning
> it. Please bear with me if my question is too dumb.

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/testinfected/testing.htm

> TestCase {
